an10.85:4.1: At one time Venerable Mahācunda was staying in the land of the Cetis at Sahajāti.
an10.85:5.1: “Take a mendicant who boasts and brags about their achievements:
an10.85:5.2: ‘I enter and emerge from the first absorption, the second absorption, the third absorption, and the fourth absorption. And I enter and emerge from the dimensions of infinite space, infinite consciousness, nothingness, and neither perception nor non-perception. And I enter and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling.’
an10.85:6.1: They’re questioned, pressed, and examined by the Realized One, or by one of his disciples who has the absorptions, and is skilled in attainments, in the minds of others, and in the ways of another’s mind.
an10.85:6.2: Questioned in this way they get stuck or lose their way. They meet with tragedy and disaster.
an10.85:7.1: The Realized One or one of his disciples comprehends their mind and investigates:
an10.85:7.2: ‘Why does this venerable boast and brag about their achievements, saying:
an10.85:7.3: ‘I enter and emerge from the first absorption …
an10.85:7.4: and the cessation of perception and feeling.’
an10.85:9.1: ‘For a long time this venerable’s deeds have been corrupt, flawed, blemished, and tainted. Their deeds and behavior are inconsistent.

an10.85:10.2: and lack of faith means decline …
